items.content_html: üìö I resumed reading Team of Rivals: The Political Genius of Abraham Lincoln last night. It‚Äôs an incredibly well-written and well-researched book. I had stopped reading it because I thought its subject matter‚Äîthe break-up of the United States due to intractable racial prejudice‚Äîhit a little too close to home for 2017-18. Regardless, I am now continuing.

I‚Äôm back to Access database work today. It looks like I will have to do even more Access work for exam procedure automation in the future, because the work will be portable and transferable to our clients that way. It‚Äôs kind of a bummer, though, because VBA is terrible. Native Python support in Office can‚Äôt come soon enough for me.

I‚Äôm heading home after two good, productive, and ultimately exhausting days in Baltimore. It will be great to be home, but I think working alone in my home office tomorrow will feel a little strange after so long with my team.
We had a nice team dinner at Aldo‚Äôs in Baltimore last night. They have the best limoncello I‚Äôve ever had. And cannoli. And great entr√©es. üç¥
I was not thrilled that today‚Äôs New York Times mini crossword‚Äôs first word contained numbers. I didn‚Äôt know crosswords puzzles could contain numbers. It bamboozled me completely! üòÖ
People on Reddit are bitching tonight about Apple‚Äôs ‚Äúbug fixes and improvements‚Äù iOS and watchOS updates. I must be uncool or something because those kinds of updates are my favorite kind.
I‚Äôm heading out for a team dinner. Maybe I would loosen my belt now rather than later. üòÄ
Oh, thank goodness for ‚òïÔ∏è. I‚Äôve got 15 minutes to down another cup before I head over to the office. It is nice to have a later start than usual today.
Baltimore‚Äôs Inner Harbor is nice. I‚Äôm glad I recognize the area in which I‚Äôm staying. My morning destination is a short walk away.

I‚Äôm on my first Amtrak ride in about five years. I forgot how much lateral motion there is as you go. My iPad is bouncing back and forth on the tray table as I watch TV on it. It‚Äôs nice to not be driving, though.
